org.kepler.spark.actor

Class SparkConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • ptolemy.kernel.util.NamedObj
      • ptolemy.kernel.util.Attribute
        • org.kepler.spark.actor.SparkConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, Changeable, Debuggable, DebugListener, Derivable, ModelErrorHandler, MoMLExportable, Moveable, Nameable

    public class SparkConnection
extends Attribute
    An attribute that contains connection information to a Spark server. The value specified in connectionName is used by Spark actors to refer to an instance of this attribute and use its Spark server.
    Author:
    Daniel Crawl

      • serverName

        public StringParameter serverName
        The host name of the Spark server. Use "local" to run on the local machine.

        public Parameter numLocalWorkers
        The number of workers when running Spark locally.

    • Method Detail

      • attributeChanged

        public void attributeChanged(Attribute attribute)
                      throws IllegalActionException
        Description copied from class: NamedObj
        React to a change in an attribute. This method is called by a contained attribute when its value changes. In this base class, the method does nothing. In derived classes, this method may throw an exception, indicating that the new attribute value is invalid. It is up to the caller to restore the attribute to a valid value if an exception is thrown.
        Overrides:
        attributeChanged in class NamedObj
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute that changed.
        Throws:
        IllegalActionException - If the change is not acceptable to this container (not thrown in this base class).

      • getContext

        public org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext getContext()
                                                      throws IllegalActionException
        Get the context using the parameters of this SparkConnection (serverName, driverMemory, numLocalWorkers, etc.).
        Throws:

      • getContext

        public static org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext getContext(java.lang.String masterNameAndPortStr,
                                                                    int numLocalWorkersVal,
                                                                    java.lang.String driverMemoryStr,
                                                                    java.lang.String connectionNameStr)
                                                             throws IllegalActionException
        Get the context for a specific master.
        Parameters:
        masterNameAndPortStr - The master host and port. If empty, then environment variables MASTER, SPARK_MASTER_IP, and SPARK_LOCAL_IP are checked for the master. If these are empty, then try to connect to a master running on localhost. If the connection fails, then a local master is used (runs in same JVM).
        numLocalWorkersVal - The number of workers to use for a local master.
        driverMemoryStr - The amount of memory in the driver.
        connectionNameStr - The connecting name string.
        Throws:
        IllegalActionException
